name: HTML
notes: Comfortable working with HTML5, HTML 4.01 Strict/Transitional, and XHTML 1.0 Strict/Transitional

name: Email
notes: I have experience in this terribly soul-crushing skill. Can I do it? Yes. Do I want to? Not really...

childItems.name: ASP.net
childItems.notes: In addition to maintaining & updating the front-end portion of sites using this structure, I'm comfortable tracking down back-end control components causing display issues.

childItems.name: CSS
childItems.notes: Comfortable working in with both CSS 2.1 and 3. Competent in testing and debugging cross-browser/platform issues.

name: JavaScript
notes: While I generally prefer to use a library (jQuery/Underscore/etc) for more advance scripting, I routinely use vanilla JavaScript for low-level object/value manipulation in an effort to limit necessary overhead. I'm also completely comfortable debugging any JavaScript related issue.

childItems.name: SVN
childItems.notes: The majority of the work I do for Links Technology is managed via SVN. All of my interaction with the systems is handled through the TortoiseSVN client

childItems.name: Git
childItems.notes: Most of my personal work that is version controlled is managed via Bitbucket & GitHub. Generally I use "SourceTree" GUI (have previously used "GitHub for Windows" & "TortoiseGit"), but I am capable of working at the command line level to resolve conflicts and other issues
